Message.Title: Let O-bama and the Government do it for you! The Messiah knows best.
Message.Msg: Postal Service's losses soar to record $15.9B. The U.S. Postal Service's FY loss more than tripled to $15.9B, mainly due to defaults of over $11B. Revenue slipped 0.8% to $65.2B as mailing volume declined 5%, although online shopping helped boost package revenue 8.7%, suggesting it's not all doom in the Internet age. However, paralysis due to Congressional control and labor costs continue to maim the USPS, with the latter accounting for 80% of expenses vs 61% at UPS (UPS) and 41% at FedEx (FDX).

Topic.Title: Fiscal Cliff Notes

Message.Msg: For conversation, assume the baby boomers are an anomaly in the Social Security equation. How would social security look if the anomaly was removed or levelized? A train of thought on social security and the Federal Government: it would seem better for the government to only be exposed to the risk of social security default instead of the full liability of social security. Accepting the risk of default of social security would appear to be less risk than assuming the full liability of social security given this point in time.

Message.Title: Why just let Carol Galante handle it. She can handle a bailout! Don't listen to Republicans.
Message.Msg: November, 2012 FHA losses hit $16.3B. The Federal Housing Aministration's projected losses amounted to a much larger-than-forecast $16.3B at the end of September, an annual independent report shows, with the agency holding reserves of $30.4B vs expected losses of $46.7B on the loans it has insured. A bailout of the FHA, which is suffering badly from backing loans made from 2007-2009, is getting ever more likely, although a decision won't be made until February. ................................................................................................................................................................. December, 2011 The Obama administration’s pick to run to lead the Federal Housing Administration has run into trouble in the U.S. Senate amid concerns that the agency will require a taxpayer bailout. The Senate Banking Committee voted Tuesday to approve Carol Galante as an assistant Housing and Urban Development secretary and head of the FHA. Her nomination, however, was approved only by a 13-9 vote. Many Republicans voiced concerns about the FHA’s deteriorating financial health after an independent audit warned last month that the agency could soon run out of money and require a taxpayer bailout. Republicans said they were worried about whether the Obama administration is doing enough to stabilize the agency’s finances – and whether officials are doing enough on to tackle the broader issue of how to overhaul the U.S. mortgage market. “I think we need people now in the administration with a sense of urgency about the need to turn things around, reduce our debt, and to avoid further bailouts,” said Sen. Jim DeMint (R., S.C.). “She does not appear to have that sense of urgency.”

Message.Title: **DRAM $0.5 with $5 Market Cap is a Potential Multi-bagger......DRAM and AMD recently signed an agreement to launch an aggressive campaign to market all editions of AMD's Radeon RAMDiskAMD Memory modules for desktops......Per the agreement, DRAM will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk...... AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times are expected to be 525% higher than those offered by conventional products.
Message.Msg: TARGET $1.5++ BY YEAR END DRAM will report significantly improved results in 3 weeks and expectations are that they will return to profitability as a result of the AMD and other recent deals. DRAM has announced a huge deal with AMD on September 8. 2012 that is sure to take it to the next level in terms of revenues and net income. DRAM with only 5M share float and $6 million market cap is super-undervalued trading at a 0.15 X Sales. The company was almost break-even before this gigantic news for tiny DRAM. The company has a strong balance sheet and ZERO debt. The initial market being targeted for the new AMD/DRAM Radeon RAMDisk are gaming enthusiasts .....other applications following super-fast processing will follow shortly. Per the agreement, DRAM will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk. AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times are expected to be 525% higher than those offered by conventional products, increasing performance, eliminating bottlenecks and improving the gaming experience on the PC as well as other applications requiring fast processing like complex engineering simulation models. AMD Radeon RAMDisk utility will be available from October to December this year. DRAM develops, manufactures, and markets large capacity memory products primarily used in high performance network servers and workstations worldwide. The company has more than 70 Fortune 100 customers and it’s been in business since 1967. DRAM engineers recently attended the kick-off of the Radeon program at AMD's HQ: 10/18/2012 DRAM news: Dataram to Attend AMD Radeon™ ExtravaLANza Wed, Oct 17, 2012 12:30 PM EDT PRINCETON, N.J.--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- Dataram Corporation (DRAM), a leading international manufacturer of computer memory, storage and software products, is proud to announce its participation at the AMD inaugural Radeon™ ExtravaLANza event on October 20, 2012 in support of the launch of AMD Radeon™ RAMDisk. The company recently announced a formal agreement with AMD to develop an AMD-branded version of its Dataram RAMDisk™, marketing the product under the name Radeon™ RAMDisk and offering gaming enthusiasts the ability to improve load times for a substantially enhanced gaming experience. Dataram representatives will be demonstrating the performance of Radeon™ RAMDisk and interacting directly with end users to answer questions and dialog about their experience with the product. Dataram will also be giving away free Radeon™ RAMDisk licenses to those end users who demonstrate the highest-performing and most creative uses of the product. The event, taking place in Markham, ON, Canada from Noon to 6:00 PM, is an opportunity to visit AMD’s Canadian headquarters and talk to some of AMD's leading global hardware and software partners. New technologies will be showcased and attendees will have an opportunity to win some great prizes. On September 8, 2012 TechNews Science and Technology published the following article about AMD's plans to launch an aggressive campaign to encourage all editions of its AMD Memory modules for desktops, and to achieve this has made an agreement with Dataram (NASDAQ: DRAM) known developer of memory modules for servers, workstations and desktops, plus other solutions and associated services; agreement that will develop a special edition RAMDisk utility, which will be called AMD Radeon RAMDisk and come free with AMD Memory memory modules. AMD Radeon RAMDisk loading times offer up to 525% higher in games and applications (better than that offered by SSDs), increasing performance, eliminating bottlenecks and improving the gaming experience on the PC. AMD Radeon RAMDisk utility will be available from October to December this year, and although AMD or Dataram gave more details on its operation, we assume that this utility to create a RAM disk to use by way of a fast disk cache, based on the Game and application profiles present in the Catalyst Control Center utility, which comes bundled with graphics cards, motherboards (chipset) and AMD APUs. On September 14, 2012, DRAM stated the following in its fiscal 1Q 2013 earnings report: During this quarter the Company entered into two agreements which we expect will generate growth and profits for Dataram in 2013 and beyond: - An agreement with AMD provides for Dataram to develop and sell AMD licensed and branded versions of its RAMDisk software. AMD’s Radeon RAMDisk will target the gaming enthusiast community. - An agreement with Shoreline Memory Inc. ("Shoreline") and the other with Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. ("AMD") for the purpose of expanding our customer base and product offerings. The Shoreline Agreement provides for Dataram to fulfill 50% of the orders Shoreline receives from its primary customers. Management believes these agreements will provide new revenue sources and expanded markets for the Company's products. Mr. Freeman concluded, “These recent agreements and other new opportunities we are currently pursuing should provide new sources of revenue, profit and growth for Dataram in 2013 and beyond. The experience, knowledge and assets we have gained from our current RAMDisk product, in the development of caching software and in solid state products are building a strong foundation for growth.” DRAM is also an unrecognized cloud play. DRAM makes the XcelaSAN memory/storage family of products for cloud and all other applications. The company recently received $5 million from a Japanese company to allow the non-exclusive right to manufacture products using the XcelaSAN technology. ABOUT DRAM Dataram Corporation (NASDAQ: DRAM), an independent memory manufacturer, develops, manufactures, and markets large capacity memory products primarily used in high performance network servers and workstations worldwide. It offers customized memory solutions for original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) and compatible memory for computers manufactured by various companies. The company also manufactures a line of memory products for Intel and AMD motherboard based servers. In addition, it develops, manufactures, and markets a line of storage caching products. The company sells its memory products to OEMs, distributors, value-added resellers, and end-users. Dataram Corporation was founded in 1967 and is based in Princeton, New Jersey GOOD LUCK!!!!

A major part of the de-mesmerization will occur naturally as Obama fails to deliver on the majority of his promises. Topic.Title: Every Fox pundit, and Rove, Rush, Beck, Morris--called EVERYTHING WRONG!!

Message.Msg: i believe all Americans became exhausted from the campaigning, debates, etc. it dragged on way too long. i do believe that obummer's campaigning people used the internet much better than romney;s crew. i also think that the debates and nomination should have ended earlier for the republicans as they beat the helX out of each other instead of attacking obummer's record and policies. imo, obummer knew about benghasi and petraeus's affair in oct. and also kept that covered up. liberal media still will not report or investigate either matter. fast and furious is all but forgotten but if GWB administration had pulled any of those 3 things, the liberal media would be calling for impeachment. just wait till middle class America sees obamacare for what it is. watch obummer's favorable rating dramatically drop. he won't care. he is a lame duck who is going to push America further and further towards socialism. jmho-bucko ps-wonder what the fuel and labor bill was for the pres. to use airforce 1 to do all that campaigning???

Topic.Title: John McCain: Unfit for "senatorial duty"

Message.Msg: we knew the country was going downhill slowly for years but many pretended not to notice. Remember Ross Perot and his stance against NAFTA,GATT and WTO? Well folks, globalization is here and it is affecting all of western civilization. Some say it's because of labor,some say it's wacko environmentalists,etc. etc. how the real Gorilla is free trade--but it is not really "free trade".I think politicans know how to repair America's damage but lack the will, so for them it is easier to play republican vs democrat
